column1:
3.6.1.3	
Mechanical devices
Mechanical devices (vacuum tumescence devices and penile rings) may be effective but are less popular [436-440].

Do not screen for or treat asymptomatic bacteriuria in patients with neuro-urological 
disorders.
Avoid the use of long-term antibiotics for recurrent urinary tract infections (UTIs).

In patients with recurrent UTIs, optimise treatment of neuro-urological symptoms and 
remove foreign bodies (e.g., stones, indwelling catheters) from the urinary tract.

Individualise UTI prophylaxis in patients with neuro-urological disorders as there is no 
optimal prophylactic measure available.
